meanings.sent1: The inexorable force of gravity pulled the object downward.
meanings.sent2: The inexorable march of time waits for no one.
meanings.sent3: The inexorable rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: Her inexorable determination to succeed propelled her forward.
meanings.sent5: The inexorable growth of the plant amazed us all.

meanings.sent1: The inexorable waves crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent2: His inexorable pursuit of justice never wavered.
meanings.sent3: The inexorable alarm clock refused to let him sleep in.
meanings.sent4: The inexorable march of progress cannot be halted.
meanings.sent5: The inexorable march of time waits for no one.

meanings.definition: Not able to be persuaded or influenced.
meanings.sent1: Her inexorable belief in her cause never faltered.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's inexorable grip on power seemed unbreakable.
meanings.sent3: The cat's inexorable demand for treats was both amusing and annoying.
meanings.sent4: The inexorable pull of tradition kept them rooted in the past.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's inexorable rules maintained order in the classroom.
